item.title: I don't get hugo as much as I would like to
item.description: This is my third attempt to use Hugo. I must admit some times trying to persuade it that a post is not a draft is a bit painful. And to be honest I am not sure if it is Hugo’s fault or the theme’s. For what is worth I desided I am going to keep using it. There are a bunch of static site generators and each time I try to check which one I should use I end up on Jekyll.

item.title: About
item.description: This will contain info about me in the future

item.title: I Would Love to Use Alacritty But... (update)
item.description: (update) I cannot just sit standing with an issue like this so I looked around and found a solution. Adding the following under keybindings section of alacritty configuration file seems to do the trick: - { key: Key3, mods: Alt, chars: "\x23" } A few days ago I started working on my dotfiles. I was sold on the idea of using that new kid in the block called alacritty. A brand new and shiny [rust] built terminal emulator which is woshiped by terminal hipsters lately.
